answer.final_answer: The distance between Dakar and Saly Portudal is 86.97km, and it takes approximately 1 hour and 4 minutes to travel. The directions are as follows: Depart from Dakar, pass through a roundabout, exit the roundabout onto a new name road, enter a rotary, exit the rotary, turn onto a road, and continue until you reach Saly Portudal. In the region of Mbour, there are two hospitals: BARTHEMY located at Mbour 1 rue 13, Thiès, and Hopital Barthimée located at Rond point de la bulangerie Rocade, Thiès. answer.final_answer:
Here is a list of official recipes from ComfyFood's website:

1. Bolo de Cenoura
   Description: Um delicioso bolo de cenoura com cobertura de chocolate.
   Ingredients: Cenoura (3 unidades), Farinha de trigo (2 xícaras), Açúcar (1 xícara), Ovos (4 unidades), Óleo (1 xícara), Baunilha (1 colher de chá), Fermento em pó (1 colher de sopa)

2. Salmão Grelhado com Molho de Limão
   Description: Um prato delicioso de salmão grelhado, servido com um molho cítrico de limão e um toque de ervas.
   Ingredients: Filé de salmão (4 unidades), Sal e pimenta-do-reino a gosto, Azeite (2 colheres de sopa), Suco de limão (2 colheres de sopa), Alho picado (1 dente), Coentro picado (1 colher de sopa), Salsinha picada (1 colher de sopa)

3. Arroz com Lentilha e Legumes
   Description: Um prato saudável e saboroso para uma refeição completa.
   Ingredients: Lentilha - 1 xícara, Arroz - 1 xícara, Cenoura - 1 unidade, Abobrinha - 1 unidade, Brócolis - 1 maço, Cebola - 1 unidade, Alho - 2 dentes, Azeite - a gosto

Here are the available recipe categories: Carne, Peixe, Marisco, Vegan, Vegetariano, Sem Glúten, Sem Açúcar, Sem Lactose, À base de soja, Pequeno-almoço, Lanche, Sobremesa, Entradas, Aperitivos, Doces, Bolos, Tortas, Massa, Pizzas

2. Salmão Grelhado com Molho de Limão
   Description: Um prato delicioso de salmão grelhado, servido com um molho cítrico de limão e um toque de ervas.

3. Arroz com Lentilha e Legumes
   Description: Um prato saudável e saboroso para uma refeição completa.
   Ingredients: Lentilha - 1 xícara, Arroz - 1 xícara, Cenoura - 1 unidade, Abobrinha - 1 unidade, Brócolis - 1 maço, Cebola - 1 unidade, Alho - 2 dentes, Azeite - a gosto

}

- Allergies: This breed has a potential for allergies, so it's important to provide proper care and attention.
- Health and Grooming: The Afghan Hound requires regular grooming to maintain its beautiful coat. It is also prone to certain health issues such as hip dysplasia, eye problems, and skin conditions.
- Exercise Needs: This breed has moderate exercise needs. Daily walks and occasional opportunities to run in a secure area are recommended.
- Temperament: Afghan Hounds are often described as aloof and dignified. They can be independent and reserved but are also known to be affectionate and loyal to their families.

symbol.description:
Symbol for the traiding pair

You can see every traiding pair available [here](https://coinmarketcap.com/en/exchanges/binance)

limit.description:
Amount of candles in the chart

- Default: 16
- Type: Integer. Maximum 1000

interval.description:
Time interval for each candle.

- Default: 1m

## Time intervals
- m: Minutes
- h: Hours
- d: Days
- w: Weeks
- M: Months

List of intervals:
- 1m
- 3m
- 5m
- 15m
- 30m
- 1h
- 2h
- 4h
- 6h
- 8h
- 12h
- 1d
- 3d
- 1w
- 1M

lastprice.description: The last price that the chart must have. This could be useful if there is some delay between your analysis and the call to this API, and that delay could make a difference between the numbers and the chart. If not given, the chart will be created with Bina

available_tools.name: google_search_for_value_serp
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "value_serp", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The google_search_for_value_serp Parameters are applicable when making a request to the Search API to retrieve Google search results for a given search term. The search term is specified in the q parameter. The location your search is run from is determine"

q.description: The keyword you want to use to perform the search.

include_answer_box.description: Determines whether to include the answer box (sometimes called the \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"featured snippet\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\") in the `organic_results` array and treat it as the first result. This may be desirable if you treat the result Bing displayed in the `answe

page.description: Determines the page of results to return, defaults to `1`. Use in combination with the num parameter to implement pagination.

flatten_results.description: Can be set to `true` or `false`. Determines whether VALUE SERP flattens the `inline_videos`, `inline_images`, `inline_tweets`, `top_stories` and `local_results` and shows them inline with the `organic_results`. This is useful if you want a simplified list

nfpr.description: Determines whether to exclude results from auto-corrected queries that were spelt wrong. Can be set to `1` to exclude auto-corrected results, or `0 `(default) to include them.

tbs.description: Sets a specific string to be added to the Google `tbs` parameter in the underlying Google query. The `tbs` parameter is normally generated automatically by the API, but it can be set explicitly also.

num.description: Determines the number of results to show per page. Use in combination with the `page` parameter to implement pagination.

time_period_max.description: Determines the maximum (i.e. 'to') time to use when `time_period` is set to `custom`. Should be in the form `MM/DD/YYYY`, I.e. for 31st December 2018 `time_period_max` would be `12/31/2018`.

safe.description: Determines whether `Safe Search` is enabled for the results. Can be set to `active` to enable Safe Search, or `off` to disable Safe Search.

knowledge_graph_id.description: The `knowledge_graph_id` request parameter sets the `kgmid` Google parameter. You can use this to prompt a specific knowledge graph to show in the results, an example would be `knowledge_graph_id=/m/0jg24`

uule.description: The Google UULE parameter - use to pass through a custom `uule` parameter to Google. VALUE SERP automatically generates the `uule` when you use the `location` parameter but we allow you to overwrite it directly by specifying a `uule` directly.

lr.description: The `lr` parameter limits the results to websites containing the specified language. View the full list of supported `lr` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-lr-languages).

cr.description: The `cr` parameter instructs Google to limit the results to websites in the specified country. View the full list of supported `cr` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-cr-countries).

filter.description: Determines if the filters for` Similar Results` and `Omitted Results` are on or off. Can be set to `1` (default) to enable these filters, or `0` to disable these filters.

time_period_min.description: Determines the minimum (i.e. 'from') time to use when `time_period` is set to `custom`. Should be in the form `MM/DD/YYYY`, I.e. for 31st December 2018 `time_period_min` would be `12/31/2018`.

google_domain.description: The Google domain to use to run the search query. View the full list of supported `google_domain` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-domains). Defaults to `google.com`.

time_period.description: Determines the time period of the results shown. It can be set to `last_hour`, `last_day` (for the last 24 hours), `last_week` (for the last 7 days), `last_month`, `last_year` or `custom`. When using `custom` you must also specify one or both of the `time_

location.description: Determines the geographic location in which the query is executed. You can enter any location as free-text, but if you choose one of the VALUE SERP[ built-in locations](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api) then the `google_domain`, `gl` and `hl` p

hl.description: The `hl` parameter determines the Google UI language to return results. View the full list of supported `hl` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-languages). Defaults to `en`.

location_auto.description: If the `location` field is set to a VALUE SERP [built-in location](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api) from the [Locations API](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api), and `location_auto` is set to `true` (default) then the `google_domain`

gl.description: The `gl` parameter determines the Google country to use for the query. View the full list of supported `gl` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-countries). Defaults to `us`.

2. Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
3. The best revenge is massive success. - Frank Sinatra
4. Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. - Henry David Thoreau
5. The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus. - Bruce Lee

And the Quote of the Day to include in your slides is: 'An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.'

13734.query: Could you please fetch the available label shapes in A4 format? I'm looking for label shapes provided by Megastar. Additionally, I want to generate a PDF file for printing labels on dynamically generated label templates. The label content will be an image with the URL 'https://ecardify.io/images/iam/video-audio-reviews.jpg'.

available_tools.name: label_templates_for_print_your_own_labels_and_stickers
available_tools.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "print_your_own_labels_and_stickers", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "List of label templates filtered by one or more of the following parameters:
paper format
template brand
exact label size
approximate label size
label shape"

format.description:
Its value can be either 
**Letter**
or 
**A4** 
They represent the two world standard printer paper sizes, respectively 8.5 inch by 11 inch and 210 mm by 297 mm.

brand.description:
Label manufacturer's name.
This is the current list of possible values. We will continue adding new brands.
Avery
Herma
Onlinelabels
Uline
Megastar
Sheetlabels

code.description:
It is a string that represents **average** label sizes, in the format [width]x[height].
For example:
**2.5x4**
or 
**70x40**

Being average sizes, means that they represent all sizes that are close to them. 
E.g. **3x2** would represent any other close siz

shape.description:
Label shape.
Valid values are:
square
rectangle
circle
oval

available_tools.name: generated_label_templates_for_print_your_own_labels_and_stickers
available_tools.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "print_your_own_labels_and_stickers", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Generates the PDF file which contains the printout of labels.

The label template will be generated on the fly, based on the label layout dimensions that you will supply on every request.
The content printed on each label, is the image whose URL is supplie"

rightmargin.description:
The distance from the right edge of the paper to the right edge of the last column of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

labelheight.description:
The height of the label.
When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

bottommargin.description:
The distance from the bottom edge of the paper to the bottom edge of the last row of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

topmargin.description:
The distance from the top edge of the paper to the top edge of the first row of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

templatecode.description:
It is the paper format upon which the system will generate the label layout template.
Valid values are **A4** and **Letter**

leftmargin.description:
The distance from the left edge of the paper to the left edge of the first column of labels.

When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

labelwidth.description:
The width of the label.
When the template code is **Letter**,  its value will count in inches.
When the template code is **A4**,  its value will count in millimeters.

labelcontent.description: The Url of the image that you are going to print on labels.

heightratio.description:
The percentage of label height that will be occupied by the printed image. E.g. value **80** means that there will be a 10% blank space on top, and another 10% at the bottom of each label.

Default value is **80**.
Minimum acceptable value is **40**, and t

marker.description:
Markers help making sure that printing is perfectly centered on each label.
By default no marker will be printed.

Possible values are:
**0** - no markers
**1**-  Dots
**2**- Ccrosses
**3**- Lines

available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "currency_converter_v3", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint is used to perform currency conversion between multiple currencies. The endpoint accepts input parameters in the form of the amount of money, source currency, and one or more target currencies."

target.description: This parameter specifies the currency code of the currency that you want to convert to. It is a mandatory parameter and should be a valid three-letter currency code. If there are multiple target currencies, they should be separated by a comma (',') .

source.description: This parameter represents the currency from which you want to convert. It is a mandatory parameter and should be a valid three-letter currency code, such as USD (United States Dollar) or EUR (Euro) or many others.

amount.description: This parameter represents the amount that you want to convert from the source currency to the target currency. It is an optional parameter, and if not provided, the default value will be set to 1

The company designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide. Apple's website is https://www.apple.com. According to the latest balance sheet data, as of April 1, 2023, Apple has $20.54 billion in cash, $30.82 billion in short-term investments, $54.18 billion in net receivables, and $6.82 billion in inventory. The total current assets are $128.78 billion, and the total assets are $379.85 billion. The cash flow statement shows that Apple had a net income of $99.8 billion, depreciation of $11.1 billion, and total cash from operating activities of $122.15 billion. In terms of recommendation trends, there were 11 strong buy, 21 buy, 6 hold, 0 sell, and 0 strong sell recommendations for Apple stock in the past month.

1. 'Imagination is more important than knowledge.'
2. 'Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.'
3. 'The only source of knowledge is experience.'
4. 'Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.'
5. 'The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.'
6. 'Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.'
7. 'The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.'
8. 'Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.'
9. 'Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.'
10. 'In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.'

I hope these quotes provide you with the inspiration you're looking for.

answer.final_answer:
Here are some job offers from OPT-NC:
1. Job Title: Agent polyvalent à temps partiel
   - Required Qualifications: Niveau 4 (Bac)
   - Mission: Assurer les services opérationnels du courrier, du guichet et de la distribution en contribuant à l'atteinte des objectifs commerciaux des agences de la zone et participant à la mission de service public.
   - Required Experience: avoir manipulé du numéraire, avoir tenu une position de guichet manuel ou informatisé, expériences en accueil clientèle, en vente, en produits et services OPT.
   - Contract Duration: Indéterminée
   - Date of Recruitment: Juillet 2023
   - Location: Agence OPT de Poya et guichet annexe de Nepoui

2. Job Title: Technicien polyvalent des réseaux mobiles
   - Required Qualifications: Diplôme d'électrotechnicien ou Bac Pro en électronique
   - Mission: Exploiter, entretenir et maintenir en conditions opérationnelles les installations terminales, équipements, réseaux fixes et mobiles en réalisant des prestations de tous ordres.
   - Required Experience: Connaissance en réseaux informatiques et télécommunications, compétences techniques en électricité et électronique.
   - Contract Duration: CDD
   - Date of Recruitment: 30 juillet 2023
   - Location: Atelier Mobiles de la Direction des Ressources Techniques à Ducos

You can find more job offers on the OPT-NC website: [OPT-NC Job Offers](https://office.opt.nc/fr/emploi-et-carriere/postuler-lopt-nc/offres-emploi)

answer.final_answer:
Here are some articles related to specific events:

1. Article Title: NASA to Provide Coverage of Preview Briefing, US Spacewalks
   Summary: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station will conduct a series of U.S. spacewalks in November and December to install mounting hardware and a pair of rollout solar arrays to increase electrical power to support station operations and scientific research.
   Publication Date: 2022-11-03
   Event Provider: NASA

2. Article Title: NASA to Provide Live Coverage of US Spacewalks Outside Space Station
   Summary: NASA will provide live coverage of US spacewalks that will take place outside the International Space Station. The spacewalks are part of ongoing maintenance and upgrades to the station's systems.
   Publication Date: 2022-10-31
   Event Provider: NASA

available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "value_serp", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The google_search_for_value_serp Parameters are applicable when making a request to the Search API to retrieve Google search results for a given search term. The search term is specified in the q parameter. The location your search is run from is determine"

q.description: The keyword you want to use to perform the search.

include_answer_box.description: Determines whether to include the answer box (sometimes called the \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"featured snippet\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\") in the `organic_results` array and treat it as the first result. This may be desirable if you treat the result Bing displayed in the `answe

page.description: Determines the page of results to return, defaults to `1`. Use in combination with the num parameter to implement pagination.

flatten_results.description: Can be set to `true` or `false`. Determines whether VALUE SERP flattens the `inline_videos`, `inline_images`, `inline_tweets`, `top_stories` and `local_results` and shows them inline with the `organic_results`. This is useful if you want a simplified list

nfpr.description: Determines whether to exclude results from auto-corrected queries that were spelt wrong. Can be set to `1` to exclude auto-corrected results, or `0 `(default) to include them.

tbs.description: Sets a specific string to be added to the Google `tbs` parameter in the underlying Google query. The `tbs` parameter is normally generated automatically by the API, but it can be set explicitly also.

num.description: Determines the number of results to show per page. Use in combination with the `page` parameter to implement pagination.

time_period_max.description: Determines the maximum (i.e. 'to') time to use when `time_period` is set to `custom`. Should be in the form `MM/DD/YYYY`, I.e. for 31st December 2018 `time_period_max` would be `12/31/2018`.

safe.description: Determines whether `Safe Search` is enabled for the results. Can be set to `active` to enable Safe Search, or `off` to disable Safe Search.

knowledge_graph_id.description: The `knowledge_graph_id` request parameter sets the `kgmid` Google parameter. You can use this to prompt a specific knowledge graph to show in the results, an example would be `knowledge_graph_id=/m/0jg24`

uule.description: The Google UULE parameter - use to pass through a custom `uule` parameter to Google. VALUE SERP automatically generates the `uule` when you use the `location` parameter but we allow you to overwrite it directly by specifying a `uule` directly.

lr.description: The `lr` parameter limits the results to websites containing the specified language. View the full list of supported `lr` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-lr-languages).

cr.description: The `cr` parameter instructs Google to limit the results to websites in the specified country. View the full list of supported `cr` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-cr-countries).

filter.description: Determines if the filters for` Similar Results` and `Omitted Results` are on or off. Can be set to `1` (default) to enable these filters, or `0` to disable these filters.

time_period_min.description: Determines the minimum (i.e. 'from') time to use when `time_period` is set to `custom`. Should be in the form `MM/DD/YYYY`, I.e. for 31st December 2018 `time_period_min` would be `12/31/2018`.

google_domain.description: The Google domain to use to run the search query. View the full list of supported `google_domain` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-domains). Defaults to `google.com`.

time_period.description: Determines the time period of the results shown. It can be set to `last_hour`, `last_day` (for the last 24 hours), `last_week` (for the last 7 days), `last_month`, `last_year` or `custom`. When using `custom` you must also specify one or both of the `time_

hl.description: The `hl` parameter determines the Google UI language to return results. View the full list of supported `hl` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-languages). Defaults to `en`.

location_auto.description: If the `location` field is set to a VALUE SERP [built-in location](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api) from the [Locations API](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api), and `location_auto` is set to `true` (default) then the `google_domain`

gl.description: The `gl` parameter determines the Google country to use for the query. View the full list of supported `gl` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-countries). Defaults to `us`.

answer.final_answer:
The character with the ID '643c71888cabe0dcede868a3' is NT-3000, an advanced Noise Tank in Jet Set Radio Future. It posed as YoYo to deceive the GG's but was eventually exposed by Cube. NT-3000 looks exactly like YoYo but with a dark green hoodie and a red belt. To unlock NT-3000, you need to talk to Roboy after completing the game and getting all Graffiti Souls, then earn a 'Jet' ranking in all of the Test Runs for Sky-Dinosaurian Square.

The number of songs associated with the character is 3. These songs are:
1. Aisle 10 (Hello Allison) by Scapegoat Wax
2. Baby-T by Guitar Vader
3. Birthday Cake by Cibo Matto

The number of graffiti tags associated with the character is 3. The tags are:
1. BREAKER - Breaker Breaker!
2. CUB WRITER - Goof-off!
3. EDGE - Off the Edge!

answer.final_answer:
To integrate the BMI calculation API into your mobile app, you will need the following API endpoints and parameters:

1. `metric_kilograms_for_body_mass_index_bmi_calculator`
   - Parameters:
     - `weight`: The weight of the individual in kilograms (kgs)
     - `height`: The height of the individual in meters (m)

2. `imperial_pounds_for_body_mass_index_bmi_calculator`
   - Parameters:
     - `weight`: The weight of the individual in pounds (lbs)
     - `height`: The height of the individual in inches (in)

3. `weight_category_for_body_mass_index_bmi_calculator`
   - Parameters:
     - `bmi`: The BMI value of the individual

These endpoints and parameters will allow you to calculate the BMI of an individual using either the metric or imperial measurement system, as well as retrieve the weight category based on the BMI value.

answer.final_answer:
The SHA256 hash value for the text 'Hello, world!' is 315f5bdb76d078c43b8ac0064e4a0164612b1fce77c869345bfc94c75894edd3. The Blake2B hash value for the same text is a2764d133a16816b5847a737a786f2ece4c148095c5faa73e24b4cc5d666c3e45ec271504e14dc6127ddfce4e144fb23b91a6f7b04b53d695502290722953b0f. 
The SHA256 hash has a length of 64 characters (256 bits) in hexadecimal format, while the Blake2B hash has a length of 128 characters (512 bits) in hexadecimal format. 
Both algorithms are designed to provide collision resistance, but Blake2B is considered to have stronger collision resistance compared to SHA256. This means that the probability of two different texts producing the same hash value (collision) is much lower in Blake2B. Hence, Blake2B is more secure in terms of collision resistance.

answer.final_answer:
Here are some recipe ideas for your family gathering:

1. Bolo de Cenoura:
   Description: Um delicioso bolo de cenoura com cobertura de chocolate.
   Ingredients: Cenoura (3 unidades), Farinha de trigo (2 xícaras), Açúcar (1 xícara), Ovos (4 unidades), Óleo (1 xícara), Baunilha (1 colher de chá), Fermento em pó (1 colher de sopa)
   Steps: 1. Preaqueça o forno a 180°C. 2. Descasque e rale as cenouras. 3. Misture os ingredientes secos em uma tigela separada. 4. Bata os ovos e o açúcar até ficar fofo. 5. Adicione o óleo e a baunilha à mistura de ovos. 6. Adicione os ingredientes secos à mistura de ovos e misture bem. 7. Adicione as cenouras raladas à massa. 8. Despeje a massa em uma forma untada e leve ao forno por cerca de 35 minutos. 9. Deixe esfriar antes de desenformar e cobrir com a cobertura de chocolate.
   ![Image](bolocenoura.jpg)

2. Salmão grelhado com molho de limão:
   Description: Um prato delicioso de salmão grelhado, servido com um molho cítrico de limão e um toque de ervas.
   Ingredients: Filé de salmão (4 unidades), Sal e pimenta-do-reino a gosto, Azeite (2 colheres de sopa), Suco de limão (2 colheres de sopa), Alho picado (1 dente), Coentro picado (1 colher de sopa), Salsinha picada (1 colher de sopa)
   Steps: 1. Tempere o salmão com sal e pimenta-do-reino a gosto. 2. Grelhe o salmão em uma frigideira quente até que esteja cozido por completo, virando uma vez. 3. Enquanto o salmão grelha, misture o suco de limão, o azeite, o alho, o coentro e a salsinha em uma tigela pequena. 4. Quando o salmão estiver pronto, retire-o da frigideira e transfira-o para um prato. 5. Despeje o molho de limão por cima do salmão e sirva imediatamente.
   ![Image](salmãogrelhado.jpg)

3. Arroz com lentilha e legumes:
   Description: Um prato saudável e saboroso para uma refeição completa.
   Ingredients: Lentilha - 1 xícara, Arroz - 1 xícara, Cenoura - 1 unidade, Abobrinha - 1 unidade, Brócolis - 1 maço, Cebola - 1 unidade, Alho - 2 dentes, Azeite - a gosto
   Steps: 1. Em uma panela, refogue cebola e alho em um pouco de azeite. 2. Adicione a lentilha e cubra com água. Deixe cozinhar até a lentilha ficar macia. 3. Em outra panela, refogue legumes picados de sua preferência (sugestão: cenoura, abobrinha e brócolis) em um pouco de azeite. 4. Adicione o arroz e refogue por alguns minutos. 5. Adicione água suficiente para cozinhar o arroz e deixe cozinhar. 6. Quando o arroz estiver quase cozido, adicione a lentilha e misture bem. 7. Tempere com sal, pimenta e ervas de sua preferência. 8. Sirva quente.
   ![Image](arrozlentilha.jpg)

message.arguments:
{
  "return_type": "give_answer",
  "final_answer": "Here are some recipe ideas for your family gathering:

1. Bolo de Cenoura:
   Description: Um delicioso bolo de cenoura com cobertura de chocolate.
   Ingredients: Cenoura (3 unidades), Farinha de trigo (2 xícaras), Açúcar (1 xícara), Ovos (4 unidades), Óleo (1 xícara), Baunilha (1 colher de chá), Fermento em pó (1 colher de sopa)
   Steps: 1. Preaqueça o forno a 180°C. 2. Descasque e rale as cenouras. 3. Misture os ingredientes secos em uma tigela separada. 4. Bata os ovos e o açúcar até ficar fofo. 5. Adicione o óleo e a baunilha à mistura de ovos. 6. Adicione os ingredientes secos à mistura de ovos e misture bem. 7. Adicione as cenouras raladas à massa. 8. Despeje a massa em uma forma untada e leve ao forno por cerca de 35 minutos. 9. Deixe esfriar antes de desenformar e cobrir com a cobertura de chocolate.
   ![Image](bolocenoura.jpg)

2. Salmão grelhado com molho de limão:
   Description: Um prato delicioso de salmão grelhado, servido com um molho cítrico de limão e um toque de ervas.
   Ingredients: Filé de salmão (4 unidades), Sal e pimenta-do-reino a gosto, Azeite (2 colheres de sopa), Suco de limão (2 colheres de sopa), Alho picado (1 dente), Coentro picado (1 colher de sopa), Salsinha picada (1 colher de sopa)
   Steps: 1. Tempere o salmão com sal e pimenta-do-reino a gosto. 2. Grelhe o salmão em uma frigideira quente até que esteja cozido por completo, virando uma vez. 3. Enquanto o salmão grelha, misture o suco de limão, o azeite, o alho, o coentro e a salsinha em uma tigela pequena. 4. Quando o salmão estiver pronto, retire-o da frigideira e transfira-o para um prato. 5. Despeje o molho de limão por cima do salmão e sirva imediatamente.
   ![Image](salmãogrelhado.jpg)

3. Arroz com lentilha e legumes:
   Description: Um prato saudável e saboroso para uma refeição completa.
   Ingredients: Lentilha - 1 xícara, Arroz - 1 xícara, Cenoura - 1 unidade, Abobrinha - 1 unidade, Brócolis - 1 maço, Cebola - 1 unidade, Alho - 2 dentes, Azeite - a gosto
   Steps: 1. Em uma panela, refogue cebola e alho em um pouco de azeite. 2. Adicione a lentilha e cubra com água. Deixe cozinhar até a lentilha ficar macia. 3. Em outra panela, refogue legumes picados de sua preferência (sugestão: cenoura, abobrinha e brócolis) em um pouco de azeite. 4. Adicione o arroz e refogue por alguns minutos. 5. Adicione água suficiente para cozinhar o arroz e deixe cozinhar. 6. Quando o arroz estiver quase cozido, adicione a lentilha e misture bem. 7. Tempere com sal, pimenta e ervas de sua preferência. 8. Sirva quente.
   ![Image](arrozlentilha.jpg)

Enjoy your family gathering!"
}

available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "value_serp", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The google_search_for_value_serp Parameters are applicable when making a request to the Search API to retrieve Google search results for a given search term. The search term is specified in the q parameter. The location your search is run from is determine"

q.description: The keyword you want to use to perform the search.

include_answer_box.description: Determines whether to include the answer box (sometimes called the \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"featured snippet\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\") in the `organic_results` array and treat it as the first result. This may be desirable if you treat the result Bing displayed in the `answe

page.description: Determines the page of results to return, defaults to `1`. Use in combination with the num parameter to implement pagination.

flatten_results.description: Can be set to `true` or `false`. Determines whether VALUE SERP flattens the `inline_videos`, `inline_images`, `inline_tweets`, `top_stories` and `local_results` and shows them inline with the `organic_results`. This is useful if you want a simplified list

nfpr.description: Determines whether to exclude results from auto-corrected queries that were spelt wrong. Can be set to `1` to exclude auto-corrected results, or `0 `(default) to include them.

tbs.description: Sets a specific string to be added to the Google `tbs` parameter in the underlying Google query. The `tbs` parameter is normally generated automatically by the API, but it can be set explicitly also.

num.description: Determines the number of results to show per page. Use in combination with the `page` parameter to implement pagination.

time_period_max.description: Determines the maximum (i.e. 'to') time to use when `time_period` is set to `custom`. Should be in the form `MM/DD/YYYY`, I.e. for 31st December 2018 `time_period_max` would be `12/31/2018`.

safe.description: Determines whether `Safe Search` is enabled for the results. Can be set to `active` to enable Safe Search, or `off` to disable Safe Search.

knowledge_graph_id.description: The `knowledge_graph_id` request parameter sets the `kgmid` Google parameter. You can use this to prompt a specific knowledge graph to show in the results, an example would be `knowledge_graph_id=/m/0jg24`

uule.description: The Google UULE parameter - use to pass through a custom `uule` parameter to Google. VALUE SERP automatically generates the `uule` when you use the `location` parameter but we allow you to overwrite it directly by specifying a `uule` directly.

lr.description: The `lr` parameter limits the results to websites containing the specified language. View the full list of supported `lr` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-lr-languages).

cr.description: The `cr` parameter instructs Google to limit the results to websites in the specified country. View the full list of supported `cr` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-cr-countries).

filter.description: Determines if the filters for` Similar Results` and `Omitted Results` are on or off. Can be set to `1` (default) to enable these filters, or `0` to disable these filters.

time_period_min.description: Determines the minimum (i.e. 'from') time to use when `time_period` is set to `custom`. Should be in the form `MM/DD/YYYY`, I.e. for 31st December 2018 `time_period_min` would be `12/31/2018`.

google_domain.description: The Google domain to use to run the search query. View the full list of supported `google_domain` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-domains). Defaults to `google.com`.

time_period.description: Determines the time period of the results shown. It can be set to `last_hour`, `last_day` (for the last 24 hours), `last_week` (for the last 7 days), `last_month`, `last_year` or `custom`. When using `custom` you must also specify one or both of the `time_

hl.description: The `hl` parameter determines the Google UI language to return results. View the full list of supported `hl` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-languages). Defaults to `en`.

location_auto.description: If the `location` field is set to a VALUE SERP [built-in location](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api) from the [Locations API](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/locations-api), and `location_auto` is set to `true` (default) then the `google_domain`

gl.description: The `gl` parameter determines the Google country to use for the query. View the full list of supported `gl` values [here](https://www.valueserp.com/docs/search-api/reference/google-countries). Defaults to `us`.

Here are the latest ten quotes that are popular among fans:

1. "It doesn't really matter what happens in the future, or if you can win your next match. The joy you feel beating the guy in front of you, and when you're able to pull out 120% of your potential is everything." - Koutarou Bokuto (Anime: Haikyuu!!)

2. "Barriers! As you keep running into barriers, you may abandon your will... Make excuses and even replace it with hatred. Listen closely, your will... Never abandon it and always stride with pride!" - Ishikawa (Anime: Naruto)

3. "People should talk to others every day. Even if it's small talk, otherwise, their heart will grow dark and serious. Talking to others builds bonds and makes you feel grateful that you are alive. That's the kind of creatures we humans are." - Jiraiya (Anime: Naruto)

4. "No matter how scary it is, I have to face the truth head-on. That's the wish you're trying to grant. I understand now. Whatever you choose to do tomorrow, everyone will support you." - All Might (Anime: Boku no Hero Academia)

5. "Life is not a game of luck. If you wanna win, work hard." - Sora (Anime: No Game No Life)

6. "Hate the sin, love the sinner?" No. That's too hard. I can't do it. "Hate the sin, love yourself." That's easier." - Homura Akemi (Anime: Puella Magi Madoka Magica)

7. "Even if the whole world is telling you to move, it is your duty to plant yourself like a tree, look them in the eye, and say, 'No, you move.'" - Captain America (Anime: Avengers Confidential: Black Widow & Punisher)

8. "If you are a strong woman, then wouldn't doing what you believe in make you an even stronger one? It's difficult to have patience, but if you don't, you'll never meet the person who stays by your side." - Karen Kohiruimaki (Anime: Sword Art Online Alternative: Gun Gale Online)

9. "The only way to deal with scum is to erase them with a giant scum eraser." - Levi Ackerman (Anime: Attack on Titan)

10. "In the end, we are our choices." - Jeff Bezos (Anime: Redline)

I hope you enjoy these quotes from recent anime!

answer.final_answer:
As a streamer looking to create content about Diablo 4, here are some useful information:
- Most popular gameplays: [Diablo 4 - All Class Build, Best Skills & Abilities Guide - Sorcerer Barbarian Rogue Tree Explained!](https://youtube.com/watch?v=b62FpCdjUXA)
- Influencers: Don Adams, Senior Game Designer on #DiabloIV. You can find more information about him [here](https://smartable.ai/apps/diablo4/people/don-adams/).
- Communities: Discord: /r/Diablo. Join their server [here](https://discord.com/invite/rdiablo).

For more news, games, and topics related to Diablo 4, you can visit the [Diablo 4 Smartable API page](https://smartableai.github.io/diablo4/). Unfortunately, there are currently no sponsorships available for Diablo 4.

Classes:

- Mage: Summoner, Arcanist, Bard, Sorceress
- Assassin: Deathblade, Shadowhunter, Reaper

Stronghold Item Recipes:
- Structure: Armor Display Rack
- Structure: Awning
- Structure: Bar Table
- Structure: Bent Marble Bench

Battle Item Recipes:
- Adrophine Potion
- Awakening Potion

answer.final_answer:
Here are some official recipes from ComfyFood across different categories:

1. Bolo de Cenoura:
   - Description: Um delicioso bolo de cenoura com cobertura de chocolate.
   - Ingredients: Cenoura, Farinha de trigo, Açúcar, Ovos, Óleo, Baunilha, Fermento em pó.
   - Steps: Preaqueça o forno, rale as cenouras, misture os ingredientes secos, bata os ovos e o açúcar, adicione o óleo e baunilha, misture os ingredientes secos com a mistura de ovos, adicione as cenouras raladas, leve ao forno, deixe esfriar e cubra com a cobertura de chocolate.

2. Salmão grelhado com molho de limão:
   - Description: Um prato delicioso de salmão grelhado, servido com um molho cítrico de limão e um toque de ervas.
   - Ingredients: Filé de salmão, Sal, Pimenta-do-reino, Azeite, Suco de limão, Alho, Coentro, Salsinha.
   - Steps: Tempere o salmão, grelhe o salmão, misture suco de limão, azeite, alho, coentro e salsinha, sirva com o molho de limão.

3. Arroz com lentilha e legumes:
   - Description: Um prato saudável e saboroso para uma refeição completa.
   - Ingredients: Lentilha, Arroz, Legumes da preferência, Cebola, Alho, Azeite, Sal, Pimenta, Ervas.
   - Steps: Refogue cebola e alho, adicione lentilha e água, refogue legumes, adicione arroz e água, adicione lentilha, tempere e sirva.

Let me know if you need more recipes or any other assistance!
